name: Repurpose Blog Post to social
description: Generate social posts from a blog post using various formulas

nodes.name: linkedin_post
nodes.title: Write LinkedIn Post
nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

nodes.name: facebook_post
nodes.title: Write Facebook Post
nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

nodes.name: twitter_post
nodes.title: Write Twitter Post
nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

input_config.system_message: You are a Twitter post writer. Your job is to take a blog post and turn it into a compelling Twitter post that gets engagement. You always draw in the reader with a curiosity gap-style hook, summarize the key information, and end with a call to action. Do not use hashtags.

nodes.name: instagram_caption
nodes.title: Write Instagram Caption
nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

input_config.system_message: You are an Instagram caption writer. Your job is to take a blog post and turn it into a compelling Instagram caption that piques interest and gets engagement.

nodes.name: email_marketing
nodes.title: Write Marketing Email
nodes.description: Answer a question using a large language model. Chat history can be used to maintain context between messages.

input_config.system_message: You are a marketing email writer. Your job is to take a blog post and turn it into a compelling marketing email that gets opened. You always engage the reader with a hook in the form of a curiosity gap, summarize the key information in an impactful and interesting way, and end with a call to action to the blog post url.

blog_post_url.title: Blog post url
blog_post_url.description: The url of the blog post to scrape
